pullsbody:
Bumps [y18n](https://github.com/yargs/y18n) from 4.0.0 to 4.0.1.
Changelog

Sourced from y18n's changelog.

Change Log

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. See standard-version for commit guidelines.

5.0.5 (2020-10-25)

Bug Fixes

  • address prototype pollution issue (#108) (a9ac604)

5.0.4 (2020-10-16)

Bug Fixes

  • exports: node 13.0 and 13.1 require the dotted object form with a string fallback (#105) (4f85d80)

5.0.3 (2020-10-16)

Bug Fixes

  • exports: node 13.0-13.6 require a string fallback (#103) (e39921e)

5.0.2 (2020-10-01)

Bug Fixes

  • deno: update types for deno ^1.4.0 (#100) (3834d9a)

5.0.1 (2020-09-05)

Bug Fixes

  • main had old index path (#98) (124f7b0)

5.0.0 (2020-09-05)

⚠ BREAKING CHANGES

  • exports maps are now used, which modifies import behavior.
  • drops Node 6 and 4. begin following Node.js LTS schedule (#89)

Features

  • add support for ESM and Deno #95) (4d7ae94)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view
Maintainer changes

This version was pushed to npm by oss-bot, a new releaser for y18n since your current version.

pulltitle: Use MutationObserver to listen for DOM changes.
pullsbody:
- Only run pattern detection on changed nodes.
- Start the content script at document_start, otherwise we miss the window.load event (not 100% sure about this one)
- Fix "Badging" feature test.

Please note the part with "XXX: ..". I needed to add a timeout for Selenium to work, but when manually testing the same page (badges.html) it worked fine without the timeout. It seems that `browser.runtime.sendMessage` is too early in some scenarios.

fixes #601
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message:
Use MutationObserver to listen for DOM changes.

- Only run pattern detection on changed nodes.
- Start the content script at document_start,
otherwise we miss the  window.load event

fixes #601

pull_commit_message:
Use MutationObserver to listen for DOM changes.

- Only run pattern detection on changed nodes.
- Start the content script at document_start,
otherwise we miss the  window.load event

pullsbody:
Bumps [urijs](https://github.com/medialize/URI.js) from 1.19.2 to 1.19.6.
Release notes

Sourced from urijs's releases.

1.19.6 (February 13th 2021)

  • SECURITY fixing URI.parse() to rewrite \ in scheme delimiter to / as Node and Browsers do - disclosed privately by Yaniv Nizry from the CxSCA AppSec team at Checkmarx

1.19.5 (December 30th 2020)

  • dropping jquery.URI.js from minified bundle accidentally added since v1.19.3 - [Issue #404](medialize/URI.js#404)

1.19.4 (December 23rd 2020)

  • SECURITY fixing URI.parseAuthority() to rewrite \ to / as Node and Browsers do - followed up to by alesandroortiz in [PR #403](medialize/URI.js#403), relates to [Issue #233](medialize/URI.js#233)

1.19.3 (December 20th 2020)

  • SECURITY fixing URI.parseAuthority() to rewrite \ to / as Node and Browsers do - disclosed privately by alesandroortiz, relates to [Issue #233](medialize/URI.js#233)
Changelog

Sourced from urijs's changelog.

1.19.6 (February 13th 2021)

  • SECURITY fixing URI.parse() to rewrite \ in scheme delimiter to / as Node and Browsers do - disclosed privately by Yaniv Nizry from the CxSCA AppSec team at Checkmarx

1.19.5 (December 30th 2020)

  • dropping jquery.URI.js from minified bundle accidentally added since v1.19.3 - [Issue #404](medialize/URI.js#404)

1.19.4 (December 23rd 2020)

  • SECURITY fixing URI.parseAuthority() to rewrite \ to / as Node and Browsers do - followed up to by alesandroortiz in [PR #403](medialize/URI.js#403), relates to [Issue #233](medialize/URI.js#233)

1.19.3 (December 20th 2020)

  • SECURITY fixing URI.parseAuthority() to rewrite \ to / as Node and Browsers do - disclosed privately by alesandroortiz, relates to [Issue #233](medialize/URI.js#233)
Commits
  • 46c8ac0 chore(build): bumping to version 1.19.6
  • a1ad8bc fix(parse): treat backslash as forwardslash in scheme delimiter
  • d7bb4ce chore(build): bumping to version 1.19.5
  • bf04ec5 chore(build): bumping to version 1.19.4
  • b02bf03 fix(parse): treat backslash as forwardslash in authority (#403)
  • d7064ab chore(build): bumping to version 1.19.3
  • 4f45faf fix(parse): treat backslash as forwardslash in authority
  • See full diff in compare view

pullsbody: ## Features This PR adds a preferences panel (accessible from both the add-on panel and the `about:addons` page). Beyond adding this space for future options/prefs, I added two options to start: 1. Allow Instagram data. This would allow IG embedded posts to load. 2. Turn off badging on non-Facebook pages. This would not put purple circles on login buttons, etc. Resolved/mentioned issues: - #550 ### TODO - [ ] Add editable list of "contained" sites (#550) - [x] Set preference to close active tab if URL is changed to "contained" URL (#143) - Behavior should match how this is handled on M-AC. https://github.com/mozilla/multi-account-containers/pull/1835 - [x ] Style "Reset to Defaults" button - Use "Settings" every where. (No "preferences") ## Testing TBD ## Screenshots Gear Icon to open prefernces page: `about:addons` preferences pane (WIP)
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message: Added Gear Icon to Panel

Since travis CI will be disabled at the end of the month, we need to move away from it. This commit removes the old travis ci file and adds a GitHub Actions workflow that does roughly the same thing.

Fixes #704.

pulltitle: add panel for email fields to link to relay
pullsbody:
@maxxcrawford just an idea right now ... couple things I noticed that I might need help with ...

* The panel pops up when you select any email input field - should we make it only pop up when someone clicks the fence badge?
* The fence badge in the email input field conflicts with the relay badge in the email input field if both are installed. Any way to detect the relay badge and remove the fence in that case?
* Probably more I haven't thought of?
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.

pulltitle: Fixed #669 – Check target opacity for visibility
pullsbody: The issue in #669 with ArtStation is that the login modal is hidden by setting the opacity to 0, which the extension doesn't check for. I fixed this by adding a check to determine if the target or its parent(s) have 0 opacity. I also moved a comment to its relevant section.

pulltitle: Allow external scripts to be loaded if  frame ancestor is valid Facebook domain
pullsbody:
## Summary 

This PR addresses issues with allow-listed domains requesting/loading resources on Facebook. This happens on https://apps.facebook.com where Facebook has authorized the game developers to load resources from their websites into Facebook.  

- Fixes #663 


## Testing

- Log into Facebook
- Go to https://apps.facebook.com/wordswithfriends/
- Expected results: It loads without error.
  - Specifically, the FB.js SDK (`https://connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js`) should load
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message: Fixed #663 - Added logic to allow external scripts to be loaded if the frame ancestor was from a Facebook domain

pullsbody:
Bumps [yargs-parser](https://github.com/yargs/yargs-parser) from 13.1.1 to 13.1.2.
Changelog

Sourced from yargs-parser's changelog.

15.0.0 (2019-10-07)

Features

  • rework collect-unknown-options into unknown-options-as-args, providing more comprehensive functionality (ef771ca)

BREAKING CHANGES

  • rework collect-unknown-options into unknown-options-as-args, providing more comprehensive functionality

14.0.0 (2019-09-06)

Bug Fixes

  • boolean arrays with default values (#185) (7d42572)
  • boolean now behaves the same as other array types (#184) (17ca3bd)
  • eatNargs() for 'opt.narg === 0' and boolean typed options (#188) (c5a1db0)
  • maybeCoerceNumber now takes precedence over coerce return value (#182) (2f26436)
  • take into account aliases when appending arrays from config object (#199) (f8a2d3f)

Features

  • add configuration option to "collect-unknown-options" (#181) (7909cc4)
  • maybeCoerceNumber() now takes into account arrays (#187) (31c204b)

BREAKING CHANGES

  • unless "parse-numbers" is set to "false", arrays of numeric strings are now parsed as numbers, rather than strings.
  • we have dropped the broken "defaulted" functionality; we would like to revisit adding this in the future.
  • maybeCoerceNumber now takes precedence over coerce return value (#182)
Commits

pullsbody:
- Fixed #608 

Added interstitial when removing sites from the first page of the doorhanger. Revised flow to include confirmation panel when removing site, if triggered from the main panel (and not the site list manager panel)

Reference: 
- [InVision Spec](https://mozilla.invisionapp.com/share/WNREP95GJ4V#/387099855_Sites_Allowed_Into_FBC)

## Testing Steps

### Removing Site: 
- Navigate to any CUSTOM CONTAINED SITE inside the FB container site
- Open panel, click "Remove Site from Facebook Container" 
- Expected: See "Remove" confirmation panel (Exactly what is shown when going to "Sites Allowed in Facebook Container" > Clicking "X" on _Sites You've Allowed_ list) 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/74677899-26179e80-517f-11ea-8d23-bec00d0e7914.png)

pulltitle: Add subdomain support for custom sites to the container.
pullsbody:
Fixes #567 

This PR adds subdomain support for any custom site added to the container. 

## Testing Steps

_(Note – You can add sites both from the in-page badge on marked Login with Facebook forms or through the panel, adding any site manually. The testing page I define below can be added through either way)_

1. Navigate to https://accounts.spotify.com/en/login 
1. Add site to Facebook Container (by whichever method) 
1. Open https://www.spotify.com/us/, which should be INSIDE the container. 
1. REMOVE either site from the container, should both stay removed. 

I recommend trying it on a few other sites – includes sites with no subdomain (even WWW).

Test sites (adding either site should include the other inside the container)
- Google.com (vs drive.google.com)
- Github.com (vs gist.github.com)
- Firefox.com (vs accounts.firefox.com)
- Amazon.co.uk (vs smile.amazon.co.uk)
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.

1. REMOVE either site from the container, should both stay removed. 

I recommend trying it on a few other sites – includes sites with no subdomain (even WWW).

Test sites (adding either site should include the other inside the container)
- Google.com (vs drive.google.com)
- Github.com (vs gist.github.com)
- Firefox.com (vs accounts.firefox.com)
- Amazon.co.uk (vs smile.amazon.co.uk)
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.

pulltitle: Fixed #585 - Added confirmation interstitial when adding/removing sites from the container
pullsbody:
Fixes #585 

Added interstitial confirmation panel when adding site to the container.
Revised flow to include confirmation panel when removing site, if triggered from the main panel (and not the site list manager panel)

Reference: 
- [InVision Spec](https://mozilla.invisionapp.com/share/WNREP95GJ4V#/387099855_Sites_Allowed_Into_FBC)

## Testing Steps

### Adding Site: 
- Navigate to any non-FB container site in browser (Ex: firefox.com) 
- Open panel, click "Allow Site in Facebook Container"
- Expected: See "Allow" confirmation panel. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/74677910-2c0d7f80-517f-11ea-9fea-14eafc1725f2.png)


### Removing Site: 
- Navigate to any CUSTOM CONTAINED SITE inside the FB container site
- Open panel, click "Remove Site from Facebook Container" 
- Expected: See "Remove" confirmation panel (Exactly what is shown when going to "Sites Allowed in Facebook Container" > Clicking "X" on _Sites You've Allowed_ list) 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/74677899-26179e80-517f-11ea-8d23-bec00d0e7914.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/74677881-1e57fa00-517f-11ea-87a5-2e5265cf3354.png)
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message:
Fixed #585
Added interstitial confirmation panel when adding site to the container.
Revised flow to include confirmation panel when removing site, if triggered from the main panel (and not the site list manager panel)

pulltitle: Add Custom Sites to the Facebook Container
pullsbody:
This PR adds buttons to the doorhanger panel for users to add/remove the active page/domain to the Facebook container. 

Fixes #422 
Fixes #550  

**PR To-do List**
- [x] Update onboarding panel copy/images
- [x] Add tooltip text
- [x] Fix issue where "Add this site" shows up on default FB URLs (from [FACEBOOK_DOMAINS](https://github.com/mozilla/contain-facebook/blob/master/src/background.js#L7-L23)) 
- [x] Add test directions to this PR 

## Testing Steps

Use the following directions to verify this PR works as is. 

1. **Run the add-on.** _(This will open up the add-on in a temporary new browser)_

```
$ web-ext run -s src/ 
```

2. **Go to the following sites:** 

- Non-Facebook tracking site: 
  - https://duckduckgo.com/ (There should be no Facebook trackers blocked on this site) 
- Facebook domain 
  - https://facebook.com/
-  Facebook tracking site
  - https://maxxcrawford.github.io/social-implementation-examples/facebook/login/
  - https://buzzfeed.com/

3. Once on the site, verify that trackers are detected as expected. 

4. Click on the Facebook Container add-on icon within the browser chrome to trigger the panel:   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71749332-bce00400-2e3a-11ea-9019-4540b8068d19.png)

5. Attempt to add that site to the Facebook Container: 

- Non-Facebook tracking site and Facebook tracking site should be able be to added by clicking the following button:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71749368-d4b78800-2e3a-11ea-8c6d-501ed8258413.png)

Once this button is clicked, the expected action is for the tab to close and reopen the same URL **INSIDE** the Facebook Container. 

6. Once added, attempt to remove the newly added site from the Facebook Container: 
- Confirm you're in the Facebook Container
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71749446-13e5d900-2e3b-11ea-90f1-5412334c20af.png)

- Click on the Facebook Container add-on icon within the browser chrome to trigger the panel: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71749561-66bf9080-2e3b-11ea-869c-7421b09c1109.png)

  - On default Facebook Container sites (like Facebook.com and Instagram.com), these sites cannot be removed. 
  - On non-default sites, it should close and reload the page **OUTSIDE** of the Facebook Container. 



## Screenshots

No trackers detected panel (outside of FB Container): 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698512-71b5ea80-2d81-11ea-8c6c-1a11c3992247.png)


Trackers detected panel (outside of FB Container): 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698562-91e5a980-2d81-11ea-881d-49bc34cb0e0b.png)


Custom site added to FB Container
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698553-8befc880-2d81-11ea-8e77-9d0d239f7b6e.png)


On default Facebook domain: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698536-86927e00-2d81-11ea-988e-f8596693316a.png)


On default Facebook domain (hover tooltip): 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698521-82666080-2d81-11ea-9689-7103a49659b6.png)


In-page UI Panel (Revised Copy + Image): 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698397-03712800-2d81-11ea-889d-5697d06156c7.png)

New Panel for Adding Custom Site: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698411-0c61f980-2d81-11ea-9d58-c0a0dd7eb816.png)
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message: Added button styles and icons for Add/Remove site to Container button

  - On default Facebook Container sites (like Facebook.com and Instagram.com), these sites cannot be removed. 
  - On non-default sites, it should close and reload the page **OUTSIDE** of the Facebook Container.

pulltitle: Add Custom Sites to the Facebook Container
pullsbody:
This PR adds buttons to the doorhanger panel for users to add/remove the active page/domain to the Facebook container. 

Fixes #422 
Fixes #550  

**PR To-do List**
- [x] Update onboarding panel copy/images
- [x] Add tooltip text
- [x] Fix issue where "Add this site" shows up on default FB URLs (from [FACEBOOK_DOMAINS](https://github.com/mozilla/contain-facebook/blob/master/src/background.js#L7-L23)) 
- [x] Add test directions to this PR 

## Testing Steps

Use the following directions to verify this PR works as is. 

1. **Run the add-on.** _(This will open up the add-on in a temporary new browser)_

```
$ web-ext run -s src/ 
```

2. **Go to the following sites:** 

- Non-Facebook tracking site: 
  - https://duckduckgo.com/ (There should be no Facebook trackers blocked on this site) 
- Facebook domain 
  - https://facebook.com/
-  Facebook tracking site
  - https://maxxcrawford.github.io/social-implementation-examples/facebook/login/
  - https://buzzfeed.com/

3. Once on the site, verify that trackers are detected as expected. 

4. Click on the Facebook Container add-on icon within the browser chrome to trigger the panel:   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71749332-bce00400-2e3a-11ea-9019-4540b8068d19.png)

5. Attempt to add that site to the Facebook Container: 

- Non-Facebook tracking site and Facebook tracking site should be able be to added by clicking the following button:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71749368-d4b78800-2e3a-11ea-8c6d-501ed8258413.png)

Once this button is clicked, the expected action is for the tab to close and reopen the same URL **INSIDE** the Facebook Container. 

6. Once added, attempt to remove the newly added site from the Facebook Container: 
- Confirm you're in the Facebook Container
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71749446-13e5d900-2e3b-11ea-90f1-5412334c20af.png)

- Click on the Facebook Container add-on icon within the browser chrome to trigger the panel: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71749561-66bf9080-2e3b-11ea-869c-7421b09c1109.png)

  - On default Facebook Container sites (like Facebook.com and Instagram.com), these sites cannot be removed. 
  - On non-default sites, it should close and reload the page **OUTSIDE** of the Facebook Container. 



## Screenshots

No trackers detected panel (outside of FB Container): 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698512-71b5ea80-2d81-11ea-8c6c-1a11c3992247.png)


Trackers detected panel (outside of FB Container): 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698562-91e5a980-2d81-11ea-881d-49bc34cb0e0b.png)


Custom site added to FB Container
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698553-8befc880-2d81-11ea-8e77-9d0d239f7b6e.png)


On default Facebook domain: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698536-86927e00-2d81-11ea-988e-f8596693316a.png)


On default Facebook domain (hover tooltip): 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698521-82666080-2d81-11ea-9689-7103a49659b6.png)


In-page UI Panel (Revised Copy + Image): 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698397-03712800-2d81-11ea-889d-5697d06156c7.png)

New Panel for Adding Custom Site: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/71698411-0c61f980-2d81-11ea-9d58-c0a0dd7eb816.png)
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.

Updated if statements to not depend on the else clause
Updated variable names to provide more context
Resolved "return await"  issue
Consolidated buildPanel function if statements

pulltitle: Fixed #430 - Updated share badge detection to treat passive links differently
pullsbody:
Fixes #430 

## Testing Steps

### Mixed Share Test Page
1. Go to the [Mixed share test page](https://maxxcrawford.github.io/social-implementation-examples/facebook/mixed-share/).
1. Confirm that only the anchor links are badged with the text: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/74461598-62cc5880-4e54-11ea-9d62-a9c7f8b14443.png)

### Buzzfeed
1. Go to any list article on [Buzzfeed](https://www.buzzfeed.com/kaylasuazo/things-thatll-help-save-your-day-from-minor-in?origin=hpp).
1. Confirm that the first share link (Big Facebook icon) should be passive. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/74461829-c48cc280-4e54-11ea-9e3b-935e5ef23b6a.png)

1. Confirm that the mini share links under each item in the article are blocked.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/74461825-c22a6880-4e54-11ea-8a19-0f6d187cc765.png)
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.

Added CONTRIBUTING.md based on: 

[Multi-Account-Containers CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/mozilla/multi-account-containers/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) repo.

Development and Testing sections based on those README.md sections in [Multi-Account-Containers README.md](https://github.com/mozilla/multi-account-containers/blob/master/README.md).

Cloned, tested, and ran the repo with npm and web-ext today using these instructions.
New to this repo, so let me know if I'm missing anything!

@maxxcrawford
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message: add CONTRIBUTING.md

pulltitle: added a range slider to change font-size
pullsbody:
this PR solves #496 Hello @maxxcrawford and @groovecoder I have added the ability to change font-size using a slider as the font was too small. It would make the addon more accessible. here are some ss for reference. 
![Screenshot (24)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24827548/67853398-af578680-fb38-11e9-9bf7-42e03dd31909.png)
![Screenshot (25)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24827548/67853399-af578680-fb38-11e9-8af5-7006a0354efa.png)
![Screenshot (26)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24827548/67853400-aff01d00-fb38-11e9-871b-b980794c2d18.png)
![Screenshot (27)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24827548/67853401-aff01d00-fb38-11e9-956e-d91f3862ba44.png)
these show the changes in font size at different positions while dragging the slider.

This pull request sets strict_min_version to 67 as recommended by @stoically in #522 .
Additionally, it removes the previous incognito mode logic and tests, as this is handled by disabling incognito mode in manifest.json.

pulltitle: Added the ability to change to dark/light mode based on user prefence
pullsbody:
hi @maxxcrawford and @groovecoder . To make this extension consistent with MAC I added the same functionality here as well. So far I didnt have any issues. But please suggest changes where required.. I'm adding some ss for reference
![Screenshot (19)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24827548/67623960-42e53a80-f84d-11e9-965d-876669921c26.png)
This is how the bottom button looks on hover. had to change the default background color on hover because the text looked invisible.
![Screenshot (20)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24827548/67623961-42e53a80-f84d-11e9-9d11-6e97a7fd1f3d.png)
![Screenshot (21)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24827548/67623962-437dd100-f84d-11e9-9c52-4a9084b57ab9.png)
![Screenshot (22)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24827548/67623966-4bd60c00-f84d-11e9-93ab-c150a6f246ff.png)
![Screenshot (23)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24827548/67623967-4c6ea280-f84d-11e9-9db5-41043677c857.png)

Hope you guys like it.
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.

pulltitle: Perf: Join the selectors and call querySelectorAll() only once
pullsbody:
Calling querySelectorAll() in a loop may traverse the DOM tree multiple times. This can be very slow on complex websites[1]. Based on Gecko profiler, joining the selectors and calling querySelectorAll() only once can be over twice as fast[2]. 

[1]: For example, https://hg.mozilla.org/releases/mozilla-release/file/tip/layout/painting/FrameLayerBuilder.cpp
[2]: before https://perfht.ml/2PgcPYf, after https://perfht.ml/2N5qSNx
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message: Join the selectors and call querySelectorAll only once

pullsbody:
Copies the `src` and [`test/functional/fixtures/badge.html`](https://github.com/mozilla/contain-facebook/blob/cb25cf8ee24c9a4b27362768ddf354763e4c718d/test/functional/fixtures/badges.html) into `build`, loads FBC using geckodriver, opens the `badge.html` and [checks](https://github.com/mozilla/contain-facebook/blob/cb25cf8ee24c9a4b27362768ddf354763e4c718d/test/functional/badging.test.js) if an element with `fbc-badge` was added.

Locally executable by either `npm run test-functional`, which closes Firefox after completion, or `npm run test-functional-dev` to keep Firefox open after the tests exit.

Also added to the travis build.

API Docs for selenium webdriver/geckodriver: https://seleniumhq.github.io/selenium/docs/api/javascript/module/selenium-webdriver/firefox_exports_Driver.html

pulltitle: Fixed #462 and #466 – GoFundMe Support and Negative Offset Badges
pullsbody:
## Testing Steps

*GoFundMe Sign in support*
- Go to https://www.gofundme.com/sign-in
- Badge should be near login/sign up with Facebook buttons* 
  - *NOTE: The positioning may be off. This is a known issue due to the react/HTML position calculations.*

*GoFundMe Share support*
- Go to https://www.gofundme.com/f/mayte039s-college-tuition
- No badge should be in the top left corner
- Share buttons should be badged on hover. 

*Microsoft Share support*
- Go to https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/client-management/administrative-tools-in-windows-10
- No badge should be in the top left corner
- Share button should be visible after clicking "Share" 

## Screenshots

GoFundMe Login page: _(Note the offset)_
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/60903720-7a48c080-a237-11e9-8962-79b10efa05f9.png)

GoFundMe fund raiser page:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/60903740-8896dc80-a237-11e9-989e-ff863d8abef9.png)

Microsoft Docs page:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/60903707-6ef59500-a237-11e9-9161-739dfaeba643.png)
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message: Fixed #462 - Added login/share support to GoFundMe

pullsbody:
Stops the Spotify login loop as show on #447 

## Testing Steps

1. Go to https://www.spotify.com
2. Click login (https://accounts.spotify.com/en/login) 
3. Click prompt to allow FBC (See screenshot) 
4. Reload page/log into Facebook
5. Go to https://www.spotify.com
6. https://open.spotify.com

**Expected results:**
All three websites (www, auth and open) should be inside the Facebook Container

## Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/60625331-23616800-9dad-11e9-8f93-6636a2f7055a.png)
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.

pulltitle: Prevent window.onload from being run twice
pullsbody: Do not call window.onload function from the load event listener: this causes the onload function to run twice, which breaks some websites. Fixes #420 Example HTML which shows that the window.onload function is run twice before this patch: ``` ``` The console will display the following with 1.9.1: ``` 1: onload called 2: onload called ```
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message:
Do not call window.onload function from load event listener

This causes the onload function to run twice, which breaks some websites.
Fixes #420

pullsbody:
## Summary 
I used the following snippet to solve the onload race condition/overwrite: https://www.systutorials.com/241284/add-my-own-window-onload-safely-without-overwriting-old-ones/ 

## Testing 

Test the following sites. _Note that unless noted, these should all happen without any scrolling/mouse clicks._ 

+ https://stackoverflow.com/users/login (SSO should get badged) 
+ https://telemetry.mozilla.org/update-orphaning (Graph should load, no badges) 
+ https://imgur.com/signin (SSO should get badged) 
+ https://www.buzzfeed.com/anamariaglavan/useful-products-youll-want-to-try-out-asap (Share buttons should get badged) 

Also added badge support for Deezer:
+ https://www.deezer.com/us/login 

## Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/58038863-c197b800-7af6-11e9-9dba-8384eafcdf71.png)

pullsbody:
Adds the "in-fbc" panel which should show when the user is on a site they've already added to the facebook container. This is a different panel than the one that shows when a user is on Facebook, or one of the other sites added by default.

I'm currently getting a "no-trackers" panelId message when visiting a site I've added to the container, so I think we may still need to set up a separate message for when someone is visiting a site they've previously added to the container.

pulltitle: Add fallback images/detection for Share and Like buttons
pullsbody:
+ Related: This PR resolves part of #258 

## Summary

This pull-request replaces standard implemented FB elements (Login, share and like buttons) and then adds a badge to it. 

**Notes**
+ This replacement is necessary as blocking the Facebook JavaScript SDK completely hides the `.fb-login-button` div. This feature also uses the data-attributes on the div to correctly size/display the replaced element.
+ Currently, the Login page has SVGs for fallback images for retina screens. Like/Share are still using low-res PNGs. This will be updated in a later PR. 

## Testing

Recreation Steps: 
+ [Run this version](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Getting_started_with_web-ext#Using_web-ext) of the web extension locally
+ Visit the following test pages: 
  + [Like Buttons](https://maxxcrawford.github.io/facebook-implementation-examples/examples/like-button/)
  + [Share Buttons](https://maxxcrawford.github.io/facebook-implementation-examples/examples/share-button/)
  + [Login Buttons](https://maxxcrawford.github.io/facebook-implementation-examples/examples/login)

## Screenshot

With the FBC enabled: 

Share Button: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/56321745-f1852180-612c-11e9-824c-1d0c4d495da9.png)


Like Button: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/56321712-e16d4200-612c-11e9-9ca9-23dbfbc4d553.png)
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message: Added like button detection for two styles of buttons

pullsbody:
Stopped the badge pollution for any link with "facebook" in the `href` attribute. 

## Testing

Recreation Steps: 
+ [Run this version](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Getting_started_with_web-ext#Using_web-ext) of the web extension locally
+ Test one of the test sites

Expected results: 
+ All Facebook subresources will be blocked. (Each attempted resource call will get a console.log) 
+ All on-page Facebook elements get an badge through it. (but does not include `<a>` tags linking to `facebook.com/*` non-tracking/API URLs) 

Example test pages: 

+ [Goolge "Facebook" Search](https://www.google.com/search?q=facebook) 
+ [Buzzfeed](https://www.buzzfeed.com/benhenry/avengers-endgame-mark-ruffalo-streaming-thor )
+ [Imgur](https://imgur.com/signin)
+ [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/AmazonBasics-Mini-DisplayPort-Thunderbolt-Adapter/dp/B00NH13K8S)
+ [Pinterest](https://www.pinterest.com/pin/326862885453847891/)
+ [IMDb](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0448115/) 

## Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/56246605-14013700-6068-11e9-8da2-fe12bdf65814.png)

pulltitle: Dynamically replace query/content for FB login
pullsbody:
+ ~Dependency PR: #265. The current branch will have to merge into the #265 branch before merging into the full `2.0` branch.~
+ Fixes part of #258 

This pull-request replaces standard implemented FB login and then adds an overlay to it. This replacement is necessary as blocking the Facebook JavaScript SDK completely hides the `.fb-login-button` div. This feature also uses the data-attributes on the div to correctly size/display the replaced element. 

## Testing

Recreation Steps: 
+ [Run this version](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Getting_started_with_web-ext#Using_web-ext) of the web extension locally
+ Visit the login page example of the [test site](https://maxxcrawford.github.io/facebook-implementation-examples/examples/login/)

With the FBC enabled:

pullsbody:
Fixing part of #258. 

This pull-request adds an overlay to all Facebook-specific on-page assets. It targets them in a few ways: 

+ Any element that has the a class of `FacebookConnectButton`
+ Any `href` attribute that contains `facebook`
+ Any `data-oauthserver` attribute that contains `facebook`
+ Any element with a `title` of `share on facebook`
+ Any element with an `aria-label` of `Facebook`

## Known Issues

+ The current method of `HREF` containing `facebook` is too broad. If you search for Facebook on Google, you can see how this doesn't match correctly. 
+ This doesn't address standard implementations of FB login. This will be addressed in a seperate pull-request.  

## Testing

Recreation Steps: 
+ [Run this version](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Getting_started_with_web-ext#Using_web-ext) of the web extension locally
+ Test one of the test sites

Expected results: 
+ All Facebook subresources will be blocked. (Each attempted resource call will get a console.log) 
+ All on-page Facebook elements get an overlay/slash through it. 

Example test pages: 
+ [Buzzfeed](https://www.buzzfeed.com/benhenry/avengers-endgame-mark-ruffalo-streaming-thor )
+ [Imgur](https://imgur.com/signin)
+ [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/AmazonBasics-Mini-DisplayPort-Thunderbolt-Adapter/dp/B00NH13K8S)
+ [Pinterest](https://www.pinterest.com/pin/326862885453847891/)
+ [IMDb](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0448115/) 

## Example Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2692333/56141561-afa87f80-5f62-11e9-8883-bcf58d60cb50.png)

pullsbody:
Fixing part of #258. 

This pull-request adds an overlay to all Facebook-specific on-page assets. It targets them in a few ways: 

+ Any element that has the a class of `FacebookConnectButton`
+ Any `href` attribute that contains `facebook`
+ Any `data-oauthserver` attribute that contains `facebook`
+ Any element with a `title` of `share on facebook`
+ Any element with an `aria-label` of `Facebook`

## Known Issues

+ The current method of `HREF` containing `facebook` is too broad. If you search for Facebook on Google, you can see how this doesn't match correctly. 
+ This doesn't address standard implementations of FB login. This will be addressed in a seperate pull-request.  

## Testing

Recreation Steps: 
+ [Run this version](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Getting_started_with_web-ext#Using_web-ext) of the web extension locally
+ Test one of the test sites

Expected results: 
+ All Facebook subresources will be blocked. (Each attempted resource call will get a console.log) 
+ All on-page Facebook elements get an overlay/slash through it. 

Example test pages: 
+ [Buzzfeed](https://www.buzzfeed.com/benhenry/avengers-endgame-mark-ruffalo-streaming-thor )
+ [Imgur](https://imgur.com/signin)
+ [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/AmazonBasics-Mini-DisplayPort-Thunderbolt-Adapter/dp/B00NH13K8S)
+ [Pinterest](https://www.pinterest.com/pin/326862885453847891/)
+ [IMDb](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0448115/)

pullsbody:
Fixes #245


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: Update browserAction for active tab when initializing and window change
pullsbody:
Fixes #228 

Removed the `await` from the call to `updateBrowserActionIcon` inside the request handler, because we don't need to wait for it to finish (and it does a `fetch` every time) in order to further process the request. Actually I'm not sure we need the call there at all, because the tabs.onUpdated listener fires in case the url changes anyway.

pullsbody:
Explicit panel when user is in Private Browsing windows, otherwise the panels would be shown as if they're not in PB.

Could potentially be replaced by [`incognito: not_allowed`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/manifest.json/incognito) starting with Firefox 67, but that would require setting `strict_min_version` to 67, otherwise the installation [fails for Firefox 66 users](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1534107#c3).

Another alternative would of course be #240 and disable the popup in PB completely.

pulltitle: fix #178: strip fbclid from urls when reopening
pullsbody:
This strips `fbclid` so it can't be used to link browsing sessions when tabs are re-opened inside-outside of Facebook Container.

However, I'm considering if we should *always* strip `fbclid` from all urls to cover a scenario where `fbclid` could link the uncontained context to an FB account with a link to a non-FB site.

E.g. an email notification contains a link to `https://www.example.com/?fbclid=12345` which embeds a request to `www.facebook.com`.

In that scenario, the embedded resource request from `example.com` to `facebook.com` includes the un-contained cookies and the `fbclid` value in the `Referer` header, which could effectively re-associate the un-contained cookies to the FB account.
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message: fix #178: strip fbclid from urls

pulltitle: fix #178: strip fbclid from urls when reopening
pullsbody:
This strips `fbclid` so it can't be used to link browsing sessions when tabs are re-opened inside-outside of Facebook Container.

However, I'm considering if we should *always* strip `fbclid` from all urls to cover a scenario where `fbclid` could link the uncontained context to an FB account with a link to a non-FB site.

E.g. an email notification contains a link to `https://www.example.com/?fbclid=12345` which embeds a request to `www.facebook.com`.

In that scenario, the embedded resource request from `example.com` to `facebook.com` includes the un-contained cookies and the `fbclid` value in the `Referer` header, which could effectively re-associate the un-contained cookies to the FB account.

pullsbody:
All recent domain additions. Includes
* edge and pixel domains with Akamai, appspot, and others
* additional messenger domain
* additional fbsbx CDN domains


## Changes
* I've attempted to dedupe the domains, [very much like the outcome of this discussion today](https://github.com/mozilla/contain-facebook/pull/157#issuecomment-431138717).  This include whatsapp domains.
* I have also organized the domains so that they are in more maintainable groups.  This make _this PR's diff_ harder to read, but will make things better going forward.

Look for comments, inline, about the additions

pulltitle: Adds missing Facebook, Instagram, and Messenger domains
pullsbody:
I noticed that some Instagram URLs are openings outside the container:

* https://scontent-frt3-2.cdninstagram.com/vp/2dcd4dd30d553fe7e9e4b4e258fca292/5C251E9D/t51.2885-15/e35/38721540_295442431039306_1380675885077626880_n.jpg

I found that the list of CDNs is outdated since [this article was published](https://blog.mozilla.org/firefox/facebook-container-extension-now-includes-instagram-and-facebook-messenger/).

Updates based on @jmdugan list, [here](https://github.com/jmdugan/blocklists/blob/master/corporations/facebook/all).

Thanks for a merge

pulltitle: Simplify storage clear; clears all data from all containers for jailed domains
pullsbody:
This includes #127 to prevent conflicts. @groovecoder please note however new domains we will have to handle as migrations to be cleared with this code. This is due to the limitation of `browsingData` now having a `cookieStoreId` filter.

This however is still simpler if we want to clear all the storages fixed here.

I also removed the exemptions that were done with @stoically's code to clear assignments.

This however breaks the current test and I'm not sure on the best way to fix this.
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.

pulltitle: Allow OAuth outside Facebook Container if MAC assigned
pullsbody:
Possible workaround for #103

* Checks if the request URL in a Facebook Container belongs to FACEBOOK_OAUTH_URL
* If it has an originUrl that is MAC assigned ignores the request
* If it has no originUrl, extracts redirect_uri= (even nested from next=)
* Checks if redirect_uri is MAC assigned
* If yes, ignores the request

Really only works if the originating URL is MAC assigned (instagram in this case). It isn't the most solid solution; but the worst that can happen is that OAuth doesn't work, like it already doesn't, and in the best case it does work. Personally I'd be equally fine with just not implementing a solution for that scenario at all.
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message: Allow OAuth outside Facebook Container if MAC assigned

pullsbody:
An alternative might be using [webNavigation.onBeforeNavigate](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/webNavigation/onBeforeNavigate) instead. However, since webNavigations aren't blockable, it wouldn't make much of a difference I guess.

Fixes #101

pullsbody:
If the Add-on initializes (install, enable, firefox startup):
* Reopen Non-Facebook Container Tabs into Facebook Container if the Tab URL is a Facebook URL
* Reopen Facebook Container Tabs into Default Container if the Tab URL is not a Facebook URL
* Do nothing if the Tab URL is MAC assigned

Includes a workaround which can be removed if [1447551](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1447551) is resolved
Includes check to only handle URLs starting with http(s) so we don't try to reopen privileged URLs
Includes #76 as well, so, this PR could be merged instead to prevent conflict

pullsbody:
Handle cases where Facebook is assigned or unassigned to "Always open in" using Multi-Account Containers after installation/enabling of contain-facebook or browser-start. To achieve this it was necessary to change the initialization behavior. The request handler is now always set-up and the check for MAC assignment always happens in the request handlers if it's an FACEBOOK_DOMAIN. Cookies are always cleared on initialization, regardless of MAC assignment. A side-effect is that, if just one specific domain is assigned with MAC, all other FACEBOOK_DOMAINS will still get contained from contain-facebook.

Also makes sure (by awaiting) that the Facebook container is correctly detected or created and hence should avoid that [this](https://github.com/stoically/contain-facebook/blob/1cceca2ccafc28b31dd1c5054ad717b2a5c4488b/background.js#L129-L130) happens.

Fixes #40, Fixes #59 and https://github.com/mozilla/contain-facebook/issues/23#issuecomment-376572752
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message: Handle MAC assignment edge-cases

pulltitle: fix #23: detect a pre-exisitng facebook container
pullsbody:
If a user installed multi-account-containers, they may already have
facebook.com assigned to a container. We detect and delete that
container, so it does not conflict with this container.

Note: I think we need to do some serious UX consideration on this. As @TanviHacks mentions , a user with facebook.com already assigned to a "Social" container will lose that entire container, and a user (like me) with facebook.com already assigned to a "Personal" container will lose that entire container.

We don't have any data on how many users fall into these use-cases, but based on how frustrated MAC users have been when updates accidentally delete their containers, we may end up frustrating MANY of our existing MAC users with this implementation.

An alternative implementation is to detect users who have already assigned facebook.com to a Container, and just leave those users alone. This seems like the safest and most non-destructive move. It could be combined with information on the AMO page describing how to use MAC for similar protection from Facebook.

Basically, I'm okay to merge and ship this implementation, but I'm also very worried about having to handle the fall-out and potential fast-follow bug-fixes from it.
pull_repo_desc: Facebook Container isolates your Facebook activity from the rest of your web activity in order to prevent Facebook from tracking you outside of the Facebook website via third party cookies.
pull_commit_message:
fix #23: detect a pre-exisitng facebook container

If a user installed multi-account-containers, they may already have
facebook.com assigned to a container. We detect that assignment, and
don't do anything else so we don't mess up their existing assignments.
